name: Overview
data: [{"id":"0b7a1874-1103-49af-a888-114191b97f3e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"File Overview: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"classes.py","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e4b22e72-8247-40df-9eaa-3a5bb70cba6f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"classes.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" module is responsible for modeling the object-oriented structure of the analyzed codebase. While other modules track functions and variables, this module specifically handles the definition, hierarchy, and inheritance logic of Python classes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"31c9f451-7e61-42dc-b93f-0adc3a2119b9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"In static analysis, determining where an attribute or method comes from is complicated by inheritance. This module provides the infrastructure to reconstruct the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Method Resolution Order (MRO)","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":", allowing Jarvis to accurately simulate how Python resolves identifiers in complex class hierarchies.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"987f65fc-88a3-414e-9ce0-523551b642e7","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"2fe8113a-9d20-4fd2-a4d4-16a70b8e88f2","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Core Purpose and Role","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"250ecc6c-51c1-4ce8-a60a-9ca5d2aa82a5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The primary goal of this module is to provide a structural map of project classes:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"13aa1c0a-90bc-4200-bb9a-748bbdc7607a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Registration","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It maintains a global registry of all discovered classes, ensuring that each class is treated as a unique entity across the entire project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"53e9124d-0c86-435c-bf5f-0e73fc7e634d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance Modeling","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It tracks the relationship between child classes and their parents.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8dd910c0-60ac-46d5-a3d0-af944eb4f87b","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"MRO Reconstruction","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It provides logic to compute and store the order in which a class and its parents are searched for attributes, mirroring Python's internal lookup rules.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c9cbf0cc-f231-42bb-b258-fbf2c071a091","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Module Linking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It associates every class with its originating module, facilitating cross-module analysis and resolution.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"842a24d0-7b9e-45e5-a06c-5d8973a9ec45","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"a9ff6e01-02d7-41ac-a554-6e7dbcc67726","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Components","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cfc7c6ac-621b-4fa8-af00-8de114f4ed01","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ClassManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (The Registry)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8a79355d-72ad-4983-bf5b-461748b69b18","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the high-level coordinator for class tracking. It manages a centralized dictionary where keys are fully qualified namespaces and values are ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects. It ensures that classes are not duplicated and provides a simple lookup interface for the rest of the engine.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6023d3bd-aed9-405f-b2d0-b744dea51c41","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (The Entity)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cde7f4e8-1cbf-4ae8-9b97-0b137ec5bc9a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" represents an individual class. It encapsulates the class's identity (namespace and module) and its inheritance list. Its most critical feature is the MRO management logic, which allows parents to be added and the resolution order to be cleaned and finalized.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7c2ea3b0-c844-4c41-97aa-e8731a2413ad","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"c34f7a57-492c-4978-8bfd-8a5c0cf5d4eb","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"System Integration & Relationship","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"12fdaebb-4d88-4b77-9a95-facd4d833e51","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"classes.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" module works closely with the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition Manager","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module Manager","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cebd4720-53c9-4009-a2ff-b997d73c446d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Discovery","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": As the parser encounters a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" keyword, it uses the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to register the new class and create its node.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"023f1557-6fe1-449a-a407-feb09b878656","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance Resolution","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": When the parser identifies base classes (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"class A(B, C)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it notifies the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"B","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"C","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be added to the MRO.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6ada10af-287c-4377-b94f-af336f961d28","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call & Attribute Resolution","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": When the analyzer sees a call like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"obj.method()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it first identifies the class of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"obj","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". It then uses the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ClassNode","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s MRO to search for the definition of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"method","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the class itself, then its first parent, and so on.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d90ae6bc-8427-4f35-8c15-90d9fcd45b1d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"832a72ef-b803-48ab-ba1b-b6601d5cc8c2","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Brief Insight / Tutorial","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a43ed1be-5e1e-4c42-8b68-af3eaf6272a2","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Modeling Inheritance","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b0465f82-f276-41cb-92de-8426da63138e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"When analyzing a typical inheritance structure, the system populates these nodes to enable lookups:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c3e41a09-c113-4540-a59c-a69e632a99b0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Creation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"manager.create(\"models.User\", \"models\")","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ec3d4aa2-20bb-480b-a188-e3ae4c3ba555","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Linking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Admin","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inherits from ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the system calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"admin_node.add_parent(\"models.User\")","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3759f78a-0820-4e03-a79e-ceab95975b02","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Finalizing","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The system calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"compute_mro()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ensure that the order is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"['Admin', 'User']","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0ab7acf8-c895-477a-943a-88177515c13f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lookup","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": When searching for a property like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"permissions","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the engine knows to check ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Admin","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" first, then fall back to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"User","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c12d26ca-2a20-479a-8e04-243eac33e750","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This robust modeling of the class hierarchy ensures that Jarvis can handle even the most complex \"Deep Inheritance\" patterns found in modern Python frameworks.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a2207423-afc9-4f16-aace-0b17e9b03686","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
